poem:
### Digital Reverie

In pixel streams  
twin sticks dance,  
neon nights unfold—  
Geometry dreams awaken,  
spark and flicker,  
a canvas of code.  
  
Oblivion's echoes  
stretch the hours,  
an elder scroll of suns  
rising, falling;  
worlds within worlds,  
time lost and found  
in the electric hum  
of games anew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From Gears of War to Uno: the 15 most important Xbox 360 games Geometry Wars: Retro Evolved (2005) Originally featured as a minigame in Project Gotham, this 80s-style twin-stick shooter was rebuilt as a standalone digital-only release, attracting a huge new fanbase. Fast, frenetic and super stylish, with lovely vector visuals, it was the game that first showed the potential of Xbox Live Arcade. The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion (2006) Tens of millions of hours". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
